intro: Tanacetum diversifolium, commonly known as the variable leaf tansy, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that vary in color and texture. Its flowers are yellow and are arranged in flat-topped clusters, attracting various pollinators. The leaves and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their antiseptic and digestive properties.
